title: Good Omens  [Hallelujah]
author: Alexandra Rowland
comment: showing the moment when they’ve fallen in love to “the minor fall, the major lift”? poetic cinema

“And love is not a victory march, it’s a cold and it’s a broken Hallelujah”

shows the “I lost my best friend” scene

ok this might be a little odd but this vid actually made me understand the song Hallelujah in a way I didn't before. what "Hallelujah" is: all these acts of love and rejection and despair and devotion and ultimate acceptance that make up their beautiful, heartbreaking centuries-long relationship, each one of those is its own Hallelujah, each one is beautiful and tender in its own way.
"The minor fall, the major lift" oh you clever dear, I see what you did there.
For real you NAILED that editing.
description:
Song: Pentatonix - Hallelujah. 
Ohhhhhhhh my god this took longer than the Bohemian Rhapsody one??? I think it's because the song is simpler so I felt like all the timings had to be SUUUUPER precise. I spent nearly twelve hours being thwarted by the timing on those six fast smashcuts right near the end. Please for the love of god can I get a wahoo, the two seconds of smashcuts at
